allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. disease

details.flavorText: Mortals whose ancestry has been influenced by celestials are known as aasimars, and angelkin, who have blood of angels coursing through their veins, are among the most common type of them. Many angelkin seek adventure as a means of doing good in the world.

description.value:
The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) If you cast this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.

Heightened  The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).
description.label: Description

target.value: 1 object of 1 Bulk or less, either unattended or possessed by you or a willing ally
target.label: Target

duration.value: until the next time you make your daily preparations
duration.label: Duration

description.value:
Your hands become infused with positive energy, healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch. If you use lay on hands on a willing living target, you restore 6 Hit Points; if the target is one of your allies, they also gain a +2 status bonus to AC for 1 round. Against an undead target, you deal 1d6 damage and it must attempt a basic Fortitude save; if it fails, it also takes a â€“2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

Heightened The amount of healing increases by 6, and the damage to an undead target increases by 1d6.
description.label: Description

target.value: 1 willing living creature or 1 undead creature
target.label: Target

description.value: Trigger The angelkin is targeted by a spell that allows a saving throw. Effect The scion gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the saving throw.

Trigger An enemy damages one of the angelkinâ€™s allies. Both the enemy and ally must be within 15 feet of the angelkin. Effect The angelkin causes its foe to hesitate under the weight of its sins as visions of possible redemption play out in its mindâ€™s eye. The foe chooses one of two options:
  • The ally is completely unharmed by the triggering damage.
  • The ally gains resistance [[/r 7 # to all damage against the triggering damage]] to all damage against the triggering damage. After the damaging effect resolves, the enemy becomes enfeebled 2 until the end of its next turn.

Trigger The monster has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack. Effect The monster snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the monster from taking an amount of damage up to the shieldâ€™s Hardness. The monster and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.
